results.title: [Atenolol use in gestosis: clinical and hemodynamic aspects].
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The response to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in combined therapy of @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@gestosis@@@ is the highest in gravidae with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperkinetic@@@ type of circulation.

citations.NLM: Shekhtman MM, Elokhina TB, Petrova SB, Sokolova MIu. [Atenolol use in gestosis: clinical and hemodynamic aspects]. Ter Arkh. 2000;72(10):49-52. PMID: 11220877
citations.BibTeX: @article{11220877, title={[Atenolol use in gestosis: clinical and hemodynamic aspects].}, author={Shekhtman MM and Elokhina TB and Petrova SB and Sokolova MIu}, journal={Ter Arkh}, volume={72}, number={10}, pages={49-52}}

results.title: [Haemodynamic response to antihypertensive treatment with atenolol in patients with hypertension (author's transl].
results.text_hl: These results lead to the conclusion that the antihypertensive action of the cardioselective beta-blocker, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ is based on a lowering of the increased peripheral vascular resistance and a @DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@reduction in cardiac output@@@; the latter mechanism is predominantly found in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperkinetic@@@ features.

citations.NLM: Zilcher H, Glogar D, Uhlir H, Leisch F, Niederberger M, Steinbach K. [Haemodynamic response to antihypertensive treatment with atenolol in patients with hypertension (author's transl]. Wien Klin Wochenschr. 1978 Sep 1;90(16):611-6. PMID: 695651
citations.BibTeX: @article{695651, title={[Haemodynamic response to antihypertensive treatment with atenolol in patients with hypertension (author's transl].}, author={Zilcher H and Glogar D and Uhlir H and Leisch F and Niederberger M and Steinbach K}, journal={Wien Klin Wochenschr}, volume={90}, number={16}, pages={611-6}}

results.title: Comparison of the effect of the beta1-blocking drugs atenolol and metoprolol on bronchial asthma.
results.text_hl: Twenty @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with severe or medium severe @DISEASE_Asthma @DISEASE_MESH:D001249 @@@asthma@@@ were given @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (Atenol ICI-Pharma) and/or @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (Seloken Hassle) for @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperkinetic tremor@@@, @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@ or symptoms of @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina pectoris@@@.

citations.NLM: Carlson C, Järvinen KA. Comparison of the effect of the beta1-blocking drugs atenolol and metoprolol on bronchial asthma. Allergy. 1978 Jun;33(3):147-51. PMID: 707790
citations.BibTeX: @article{707790, title={Comparison of the effect of the beta1-blocking drugs atenolol and metoprolol on bronchial asthma.}, author={Carlson C and Järvinen KA}, journal={Allergy}, volume={33}, number={3}, pages={147-51}}

results.title: [Monitoring of arterial pressure in the efficacy assessment of combined drug therapy selection for hypotension].
results.text_hl: There was an improvement in male subjects with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperkinetic@@@ type circulation on a combination of two drug preparations (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril maleate@@@) while female subjects derived benefit from three drugs (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril maleate@@@, @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@) irrespective of the hemodynamic type of circulation.

citations.NLM: Shvets NI, Fedorova OA. [Monitoring of arterial pressure in the efficacy assessment of combined drug therapy selection for hypotension]. Lik Sprava. 2001 May-Jun;(3):25-7. PMID: 11560018
citations.BibTeX: @article{11560018, title={[Monitoring of arterial pressure in the efficacy assessment of combined drug therapy selection for hypotension].}, author={Shvets NI and Fedorova OA}, journal={Lik Sprava}, number={3}, pages={25-7}}

results.title: Efficacy of exercise, losartan, enalapril, atenolol and rilmenidine in subjects with blood pressure hyperreactivity at treadmill stress test and left ventricular hypertrophy.
results.text_hl: In a 1-year open protocol, 195 normotensive subjects, with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperactivity@@@ to treadmill stress test and @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@LVH@@@, were randomly assigned to supervised physical exercise, @CHEMICAL_Rilmenidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077769 @@@rilmenidine@@@ 1 mg day(-1), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 50 mg day(-1), @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ 10 mg day(-1) or @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ 50 mg day(-1).

citations.NLM: Avanza AC Jr, Mansur AP, Ramires JA. Efficacy of exercise, losartan, enalapril, atenolol and rilmenidine in subjects with blood pressure hyperreactivity at treadmill stress test and left ventricular hypertrophy. J Hum Hypertens. 2009 Apr;23(4):259-66. PMID: 18946484
citations.BibTeX: @article{18946484, title={Efficacy of exercise, losartan, enalapril, atenolol and rilmenidine in subjects with blood pressure hyperreactivity at treadmill stress test and left ventricular hypertrophy.}, author={Avanza AC Jr and Mansur AP and Ramires JA}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={23}, number={4}, pages={259-66}}

results.title: Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our results demonstrate significant @DISEASE_Sleep_Deprivation @DISEASE_MESH:D012892 @@@sleep fragmentations@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@sympathetic hyperactivity@@@ during QS stages after MI, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ could restore the @DISEASE_Autonomic_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001342 @@@autonomic dysfunction@@@ and @DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbance@@@.

citations.NLM: Lin WL, Lo LW, Chen HR, Lai CT, Yamada S, Liu SH, Chou YH, Chen SA, Fu YC, Kuo TB. Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction. Int J Cardiol. 2016 Dec 15;225():65-72. PMID: 27710806
citations.BibTeX: @article{27710806, title={Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction.}, author={Lin WL and Lo LW and Chen HR and Lai CT and Yamada S and Liu SH and Chou YH and Chen SA and Fu YC and Kuo TB}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={225}, pages={65-72}}

results.title: Hemolytic anemia in a patient with hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy.
results.text_hl: She was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and the class Ia antiarrhythmic drug @CHEMICAL_cifenline @CHEMICAL_MESH:C032151 @@@cibenzoline@@@ to relieve the @DISEASE_Ventricular_Outflow_Obstruction_Right @DISEASE_MESH:D000092243 @@@outflow tract obstruction@@@, and the pressure gradient was reduced to 70 mmHg.

citations.NLM: Kubo T, Kitaoka H, Terauchi Y, Tamura S, Okawa M, Yamasaki N, Yabe T, Doi YL. Hemolytic anemia in a patient with hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy. J Cardiol. 2010 Jan;55(1):125-9. PMID: 20122559
citations.BibTeX: @article{20122559, title={Hemolytic anemia in a patient with hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy.}, author={Kubo T and Kitaoka H and Terauchi Y and Tamura S and Okawa M and Yamasaki N and Yabe T and Doi YL}, journal={J Cardiol}, volume={55}, number={1}, pages={125-9}}

results.title: [Gerstmann-Straussler-Scheinker syndrome with a Pro102Leu mutation in the prion protein gene and atypical MRI findings, hyperthermia, tachycardia, and hyperhidrosis].
results.text_hl: Analysis of autonomic function (analysis of noradrenarine in plasma and urine, coefficient of variation of R-R intervals before and after giving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, Aschner's eyeball pressure test, intracutaneous @CHEMICAL_Atropine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001285 @@@atropine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@adrenaline@@@ injection test) revealed @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@sympathetic hyperactivity@@@ but normal parasympathetic activity.

citations.NLM: Imaiso Y, Mitsuo K. [Gerstmann-Straussler-Scheinker syndrome with a Pro102Leu mutation in the prion protein gene and atypical MRI findings, hyperthermia, tachycardia, and hyperhidrosis]. Rinsho Shinkeigaku. 1998 Oct-Nov;38(10-11):920-5. PMID: 10203975
citations.BibTeX: @article{10203975, title={[Gerstmann-Straussler-Scheinker syndrome with a Pro102Leu mutation in the prion protein gene and atypical MRI findings, hyperthermia, tachycardia, and hyperhidrosis].}, author={Imaiso Y and Mitsuo K}, journal={Rinsho Shinkeigaku}, volume={38}, number={10-11}, pages={920-5}}
